abstract: Brazilian authorities seek to reduce number of false reports of birth defects by streamlining guidelines for alerting officials; major spike in cases of microcephaly, and number of false positives, have complicated efforts to confirm condition is caused by Zika virus; experts say erring on side of caution is crucial in early stages of epidemic.
lead_paragraph: After many false alarms, the government is considering tightening the guidelines establishing when health care providers should report infants born with abnormally small heads.

headline.main: Birth Defects in Brazil May Be Overreported Amid Zika Fears
headline.print_headline: Guidelines May Lead to Over-Reporting of Defect in Brazil

snippet: After many false alarms, the government is considering tightening the guidelines establishing when health care providers should report infants born with abnormally small heads.
